The Denver Museum brought a civil engineering class to the Gifted Talented students across the district recently. They began using Lincoln Logs to build a town the way that settlers in Colorado would have planned them. After they had the town built they moved on to making modern buildings with Legos. During the modern adaptation they had to navigate issues such as space, which historic buildings to level and more. It was a great day!

El Museo de Denver trajo a un ingeniero civil a la clase de Estudiantes Dotados y Talentosos del distrito. Usando Lincoln logs, construyeron un pueblo como lo hubieran hecho los primeros colonos de Colorado. Después de construir el pueblo construyeron edificios mas modernos con Legos. Para adaptar los edificios a lo moderno, tenían que considerar espacio, nivel y mucho más. ¡Fue un día maravilloso!

Ladies and Gentlemen,

The timing of this is TBA as we just can't predict when the finals of the tournament will start. North Valley Middle School hosted the January Board of Education Meeting. Mrs. Flesner along with two students Viri Cardona and Emily Benavidez presented about the community service mini course.

In the class students made Thanksgiving baskets, Christmas Baskets and hygiene boxes. They also wrote letters to deployed service personnel. All told students from North Valley wrote over 121 letters.

Viri Cardona also presented on LULAC volunteering at the Weld County Food Bank. Altogether 12 students participated. They even beat the box making record for student volunteers!
